A set of tools for maintaining firearms, mainly cleaning the barrel as there's not much else you can do with it.
一套工具，用于维护火器。主要用于清洁枪管，因为也没什么其他可做的。
A set of tools for repairing clothing and quilted items. Includes fabric for patches, scissors, needles and various threads.
一套工具，用于缝补衣物和其它织物。包含补丁、剪刀、针和各种线。
A set of tools for quickly repairing your weapons. Includes a hammer, whetstone, small pliers and mineral oil.
一套工具，用于快速修理武器。包含锤子、磨刀石、小钳子和矿物油。
Such a precious ring is intended for noble lords and prelates. A beggar should be careful not to get the noose for selling it.
如此珍贵的戒指专为贵族领主和高级教士而准备。行乞之人应当留心，卖掉它可能会惹来杀身之祸。
Such a precious ring is intended for noble lords and prelates. A beggar should be careful not to get a noose for selling it.
如此珍贵的戒指专为贵族领主和高级教士而准备。行乞之人应当留心，卖掉它可能会惹来杀身之祸。
Such a precious ring is intended for noble lords and prelates. The poor man should be careful not to get a noose for selling it.
如此珍贵的戒指专为贵族领主和高级教士而准备。穷困之人应当留心，卖掉它可能会惹来杀身之祸。
Such a precious ring is intended for noble lords and prelates. A beggar should be careful not to get the noose for selling it.
如此珍贵的戒指专为贵族领主和高级教士而准备。行乞之人应当留心，卖掉它可能会惹来杀身之祸。
Someone put it away for work. I don't think he's putting it back on.
有人将此物搁置一旁后便工作去了，我感觉他不会再来取回。
Such a precious ring is intended for noble lords and prelates. A poor person should be careful not to get the noose for selling it.
如此珍贵的戒指专为贵族领主和高级教士而准备。行乞之人应当留心，卖掉它可能会惹来杀身之祸。
Such a precious ring is intended for noble lords and prelates. A poor man should be careful not to hang for selling it.
如此珍贵的戒指专为贵族领主和高级教士而准备。穷困之人应当留心，卖掉它可能会惹来杀身之祸。
A tasty humble dish of pre-sprouted roasted or baked peas.
美味而朴素的菜肴，由刚发芽的豌豆烘烤而成。
A piglet roasted on a spit. Fat helps when you get drunk.
烤架上烤出的乳猪，它的脂肪可以帮你解酒。

A tasty and not too fatty piece. As with other game, the best meat comes from younger animals. It is advisable to let it hang out for some time before butchering, as there is still too much blood in a freshly killed animal, which makes the meat unnecessarily tough.
美味而不肥腻的肉块，和其它野味一样，幼年动物的肉会更美味。在屠宰之前最好把尸体悬挂一段时间，因为新杀的动物体内残留有很多血液，会让肉质变得过柴。

Good red meat, not as prized as deer, but not everyone can tell them apart. Prepare it the same way you would any other venison. If you have both deer and roe meat, cut up the roe meat into sauce and cook it, roast the deer meat on the fire.
优质红肉，虽不如鹿肉一般珍贵，但并非每个人都能分辨两者的区别。可采用与处理任意种类鹿肉相同的手段处理这种肉。如果你既有鹿肉又有狍子肉，就将狍子肉切成肉酱并煮熟，而鹿肉就放在火上烤制。

Good red meat, not as prized as deer, but not everyone can tell them apart. Prepare it the same way you would any other venison. If you have both deer and roe deer meat, cut up the roe deer meat into sauce and cook it, roast the deer meat on the fire.
优质红肉，虽不如鹿肉一般珍贵，但并非每个人都能分辨两者的区别。可采用与处理任意种类鹿肉相同的手段处理这种肉。如果你既有鹿肉又有狍子肉，就将狍子肉切成肉酱并煮熟，而鹿肉就放在火上烤制。
The best thing to eat while staring into the fire in the evening.
晚上凝视火焰时最好的配菜。
Well smoked venison tastes great, you just need to use the right kind of wood.
只要用对了熏制木材，熏鹿肉非常好吃。
Because they contains a lot of good tallow, you can mash them and add them to other drier dishes or porridges to improve the taste.
含有大量的优质动物脂，可以捣碎后添加到其它比较干的菜肴或者粥里，提升味道。
Cooked roe dear kidneys are a true delicacy.
熟狍子肾是一道美味的菜肴。
A foreign oil that is added to baths to make the water smell nice. This one is particularly odorous.
一种外国精油，加到洗澡水中可以使其芳香四溢。这一种气味尤其浓烈。
A dirty blanket full of fleas. Great for infesting a bathhouse.
一个跳蚤滋生的肮脏篮子，是个让澡堂跳蚤肆虐的绝佳工具。

An unusual curved blade used by nomads on fast horses in the Hungarian steppes and remote Arabian deserts, this swift weapon excels at offense and defense alike. Every good Christian should beware of losing his head to such a weapon.
一种不寻常的弯刃刀，匈牙利平原和遥远阿拉伯沙漠里的游牧民族会一边骑着快马一边挥动它们，而且这种武器攻守兼备。每一个好基督徒都应当小心，以免自己的头被这种武器砍掉。
One of the most expensive spices in the world. Less than a pinch is enough for any meal.
世界上最贵的香料之一，一撮就足以为任何菜肴增色。
Spiced salami. Smells great and tastes even better.
辣的萨拉米香肠。闻起来很香，尝起来更美味。
Spicy dried salami. The longer you dry it, the better it tastes.
辛辣的意大利干肠。晾晒的时间越长，它就越美味。
Spicy smoked salami. It smells great and tastes even better.
辛辣的熏制萨拉米香肠。闻起来很香，尝起来更美味。
Well-aged sauerkraut can cure any ailment. It is said that those who eat it regularly will avoid all kinds of diseases, including the plague.
熟成的酸菜可以治愈疾病，据说经常吃酸菜还能预防各种疾病，包括瘟疫。
A pile of scrap iron and rocks tied up in a small bag. It'll shred anyone at close range, but at a distance it's rather useless.
一堆捆在小袋子里的废铁和石块。在近距离可以粉碎任何人，一旦距离稍远就将失去作用。
Very nice bow. It was the first and last thing Ranyek won in the dice.
一把质量上佳的弓，是拉涅克在其生前众多赌局中赢下的第一件，也是最后一件奖品。
A pair of hand cannons wrapped in waxed canvas. Something's rattling, but it's probably just ammunition. I have to bring them to Zizka at the agreed ambush site.
一把由上蜡帆布包裹着的手铳。好像有什么东西在响，大概是弹药发出的声音吧。我得到事先商量好的伏击点去，把它交给杰式卡。
Bohuta's map showing the place where he buried his equipment when he decided to redeem himself.
博尔祖特的地图，上面记录了他决定自我救赎后，把装备埋藏起来的地方。
Janosh's homemade sausage, thoroughly smoked and properly seasoned. You don't want to know what it's made of.
亚诺什的自制香肠，经过彻底熏制并适当调味。但别问它是什么东西做的。

The guild longsword is a magnificent weapon crafted to celebrate the founding of the Kuttenberg swordfighting brotherhood. It was subsequently adopted as their emblem. The master swordsman, who leads the brotherhood, wears it at his side only on ceremonial occasions. Most of the time, it adorns the great hall of the Kuttenberg swordfighting house.
公会长剑是为庆祝库滕堡剑术兄弟会成立而打造的精美武器，后来，这一图案被采纳为他们的徽章。领导兄弟会的剑术大师只有在仪式场合才将其佩戴在身边，而大多数时候，它都是库滕堡剑术馆大厅的装饰品。
An excellent hunting sword of the master butcher Emmeram from Kuttenberg.
属于库滕堡老练屠夫艾默拉姆的绝佳狩猎用剑。

Long sword of the swordmaster Menhart from Frankfurt. According to his own words, he received it from his teacher the day he became a sword master. The weapon itself honours both the bearer and the maker. Truly a masterpiece!
来自法兰克福的剑术大师门哈特的专属长剑。据他所言，在荣登大师殿堂的那一天，他从师父手中接过了这把长剑。此剑同时承载着铸造者与持剑者的荣耀，实乃一大杰作！
A long sword designed for practicing swordfighting techniques and training combat. Therefore, it has no sharpened blade and its tip is blunted.
为练习剑术和战技设计而出的长剑，因而此剑的剑刃不利，剑尖圆钝。
Women's perfume with an exceptional and unusual fragrance.
女士专用香水，拥有非凡的独特香味。
Fresh fragrant flowers are always a rarity, as is true love.
真爱可遇不可求，新鲜的芳香花蕊亦是如此。
The very ripe braies of yacker Sixer.
挖客六子又脏又破的内裤。
A stolen dagger found on the arrested thief.
从被捕盗贼身上找到的失窃匕首。
A pair of gloves made of fine lambskin. They're not of much use as far as warmth and protection, but at least they look nice.
一副优质羔羊皮制成的手套，在保暖和防护方面用处不大，但外观很精美。
Documents proving the questionable dealings of Lady Anna of Waldstein.
证明瓦尔德斯坦的安娜小姐涉及可疑交易的真实文件。
Forged documents covering up the questionable dealings of Lady Anna of Waldstein.
证明瓦尔德斯坦的安娜小姐涉及可疑交易的伪造文件。
A certificate proving eligibility of a waiter to serve His Majesty, King Sigismund of Luxembourg.
用于证明服务于卢森堡国王西格斯蒙德陛下的侍者资格的证书。
A large copper kettle offers great pleasure... when it's full, that is.
一只大铜壶能带来极大的满足感......尤其是它装满东西的时候。
A finely decorated silver cup. No wonder it attracted the attention of a thief.
装饰精美的银杯。难怪会引来小偷。
A circular Cuman shield used by light Hungarian horsemen.
一面圆形库曼盾牌，由匈牙利轻骑兵操用。
A Cuman shield with a traditional symbol of the hot Hungarian sun.
带有匈牙利传统的烈日符号的库曼盾牌。
A shield made of wooden planks glued together and covered with thin rawhide. These shields are usually decorated with the coat of arms of a lord, noble family or city.
一面战斗盾牌，由胶合在一起的木板制成，还覆盖了一层薄薄的生牛皮。盾牌的正面通常装饰着领主、贵族家族或城市的纹章。
You'd rather go hunting with a crossbow than with a shield, but this knightly shield with an autumn hunting motif will reliably protect you from the hit of your antlered enemies.
与盾牌相比，你更愿意带着弩前去狩猎，但这面涂印秋日狩猎图案的骑士盾牌可有效地保护你免受鹿的攻击。
A beautiful and solid knight's shield made by the master armourer Nicolas Krondel from Kuttenberg. It bears the colours of the mining town and is an example of excellent craftsmanship.
由库滕堡的铸甲大师尼古拉斯·克朗德尔打造的坚固且精美的骑士盾牌。它涂饰着矿业城镇的配色，是精湛工艺的典范。

A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.
一面战斗盾牌，由胶合在一起的木板制成，还覆盖了一层生牛皮。其外侧通常装饰着领主的纹章，或是其它能够让战士们在激烈交战中识别出的图纹。
A guild shield. The symbols of the kneipp and leather shoes are the emblem of the Kuttenberg guild of shoemakers and novices.
一面公会盾牌。其上克奈普鞋和皮鞋的符号即是库滕堡鞋匠和学徒公会的纹章。
A guild shield. The ancient symbol of the god of medicine Apollo is the emblem of the Kuttenberg Guild of Apothecaries and Alchemists.
一面公会盾牌。人们将古代医药之神阿波罗的符号，用作库滕堡药剂师和炼金术士公会的纹章。
A guild shield. Two crossed wooden mallets and a saddle are the emblem of the Kuttenberg Saddler Guild.
一面行会盾牌。人们用两把交叉的木槌和一个马鞍作为库滕堡马鞍匠公会的纹章。

A guild shield. The axe was awarded to the czech butchers by king John of Luxembourg, because they opened the gates of Prague for him with their axes. From there, the Kuttenberg Butchers' Guild also adopted this symbol.
一面公会盾牌。卢森堡的约翰国王曾将一把斧头作为奖赏，交给了捷克的屠夫们，因为他们用斧头为国王打开了布拉格的大门。自此，库滕堡的屠夫公会便采用了斧头作为纹章。
A guild shield. The three bowls of paint are a well-known symbol of the Kuttenberg painters who decorated knights' shields and painted the frescoes in the royal palace.
一面公会盾牌。三个涂色碗是库滕堡画家的著名标志，他们不仅设计过骑士盾牌，还绘出了皇家宫殿的壁画。
A guild shield. Baking a crispy, crunchy pretzel is a royal art. The Bakers and Millers Guild is one of the most influential in Kuttenberg.
一面行会盾牌。烘烤香脆可口的椒盐卷饼是一门皇家艺术，而烘培师和磨坊主公会则是库滕堡最具影响力的公会之一。
A shield with the coat of arms of the Lords of Zimburg.
一面印有齐姆博格领主纹章的盾牌。
A true knight wields a rose more often than a sword!
真正的骑士挥动玫瑰的次数比舞剑的次数还要多！
This shield clearly displays the house to which its bearer gives allegiance.
这面盾牌清晰地展现了其持有者所效忠的家族！
A riding pavese with the symbol of Lord von Bergow, owner of Trosky Castle.
一面骑兵大盾，其上装饰着特罗斯基堡垒的拥有者冯·波尔高领主的图纹。
一面精心涂绘的骑士大盾。
A cavalry pavese with Hungarian symbols.
绘有匈牙利人图纹的骑士大盾。
A riding pavese covered with linen without a noble coat of arms.
覆盖了亚麻布的骑士大盾，其上并未涂饰任何贵族纹章。
A riding pavese with the symbol of the Old Town of Prague.
一面骑兵大盾，盾上涂饰着布拉格老城的纹章。
一面精心涂绘的骑士大盾。
A riding pavese with the symbol of Lord Pisek, owner of the Suchdol fortress.
一面骑兵大盾，其上装饰着苏赫多尔堡垒的拥有者皮塞克领主的图纹。
For a proper totentanz of your enemies, the death figure on this shield will play some serious totenmusik.
为了让敌人尽情地跳一场死亡之舞，这面盾牌上的死神将奏响一段庄重的送葬曲。
The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.
盾牌的残片，可用作柴火。
Remnants of a shield from another era, still good for kindling.
年代久远的盾牌残骸，不过仍然适合用来生火。
Low-cut shoes come in a variety of designs. These simple, comfortable shoes are popular among all societal classes.
低帮鞋款式多样，而这些简单舒适的鞋子在所有社会阶层中都备受欢迎。
Low bugher shoes with buckle and decorative clip, ideal for a short walk or into higher society.
低帮市民鞋，配有扣带和装饰性夹扣，既适用于短途散步，也适合在上流社交活动中穿着。
Simple shoes, also called krpce, tied around the ankles with a lace. Footwear mainly of poorer families.
简易鞋子，也叫做“krpce”，穿戴时用系带围绕脚踝捆绑。贫困户常穿此类鞋子。
Pointed shoes with an eccentrically long toe are worn more in the city, in the countryside they could be ridiculed.
尖头鞋，鞋尖长得出人意料，更常见于城市中。若在乡村穿着此鞋，可能会受人嘲笑。
Soft comfortable shoes made of fine leather give the wearer the confidence that his steps will be less audible. Which sometimes comes in handy.
由优质皮革制成的软鞋，穿着舒适，让穿戴者坚信自己的步伐声更不易察觉。这双鞋有时候还真管用。
Neat hands and quiet footwear are essential for success.
洁净的双手和静默的足靴是成功的关键。
A sword that was lent to me as part of the equipment for the famous Kuttenberg tournament.
一把借来的剑，是我参与著名的库滕堡比武大会时使用的装备。
A buttoned dress with a long skirt is the ideal garment for formal occasions, both for bourgeois and wealthier village women.
带扣的长裙是正式场合的理想服饰，对市民或是较富裕的乡村女性皆是如此。
A colourful dress is typical for dancers and troubadours. But wearing them is seen by many as an eccentricity and a blatant warning against decadence.
一件色彩斑斓的裙子，是舞者与诗人的典型装束。然而，穿着此衣物被不少人视为怪异行为，也是对堕落的公然警示。
A frilly, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.
带有褶边的紧身裙，抬起的裙摆露出衬裙，显得十分挑逗。此衣物正逐渐风靡，尤其在城镇之中。

A surcoat is an outer dress with wide armholes, revealing the lower layer of the garment. Evil tongues claim that such a cut attracts inappropriate attention. Perhaps because of this, it is very popular.
披风外套是种带有宽大袖孔的外衣，内层衣物会有所显露。有人说这种设计会引来不适当的目光，可能正因为如此，它才广受欢迎。
An ordinary dress intended for daily wear for peasant and poorer bourgeois women. Also ideal for travelling.
一件普通的裙子，是农民和较贫穷市民女性的日常服饰，同时也非常适合旅行时穿着。
An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.
一件普通的裙子，专用于日常家务和农业劳作。而围裙则是家庭主妇或女仆的特有配饰。

The hide of a sturdy wild boar. It is difficult and often dangerous to kill a wild boar, which is why it is a prized trophy, as well as a badge of a brave and skilled hunter. But if you're caught with it by the custodian of the local woods or his subordinates, you'll have a lot of explaining to do.
一只健壮野猪的皮。猎杀野猪既困难又危险，因此野猪皮也被奉为珍贵的战利品，是勇气和技巧的象征。不过，要是被林场管理员和他的手下发现你持有野猪皮，你最好能给出合理的解释。
Pelt from a dog. If anyone ever wanted it, just don't tell them how you got it.
狗皮。如果有人想要，千万别告诉他们你是怎么得到的。
A hare pelt. A common but useful material used for skirt hems, hats and coats. It'll fetch a few groschen for sure.
一张兔皮。这是一种常见但有用的材料，能用来制作裙边、帽子和外套。这肯定值好几个格罗申。
Horsehide is known for its good tensile strength yet considerable softness. It is commonly used to make halters, bridles, belts or even saddles and saddlebags.
马皮以其良好的抗拉强度和可观的柔软度而闻名，通常用于制作缰绳、马勒、腰带甚至马鞍和马鞍袋。
A roe-deer hide does not reach the strength and quality of deerskin and is not suitable for tanning. It is therefore mainly used as fur.
獐鹿皮的韧性和质量都不及鹿皮，不适合鞣制，只能当做皮草使用。
A sheepskin. It'll take some time before it's processed into wool, then into broadcloth, but I'm sure it'll make a fine hat or skirt one day.
一张羊皮。还需要一些步骤将它加工成羊毛，然后再制成宽呢布，但它总有一天会成为一顶精美的帽子或裙子。

Wolf hide. Rumour has it that if you sleep in the woods under a cloak of wolf fur when the moon is full, you'll gain supernatural powers or transform into one. But you don't know anyone who can confirm that.
狼皮。有传言说，如果你在月圆之夜披着狼皮睡在树林里，你醒来后就会获得超自然的力量，或者干脆变成狼。但没有人能证实这点。
One-piece helmet of plain cut designed for plain squires.
为普通侍从设计的简易剪裁的一体式头盔。
Reduces Energy to 0 and decreases perception.
能量降至0，同时降低感知力。
Reduces Energy to 0 and decrease perception. Reduces Stamina and Stamina regeneration by 10% for a quarter of a day.
能量降至0，同时降低感知力。耐力及其恢复速度均降低10%，持续四分之一天。
Reduces Energy to 0 and decrease perception. Reduces Stamina and Stamina regeneration by 30% for half a day.
能量降至0，同时降低感知力。耐力及其恢复速度均降低30%，持续半天。
Reduces Energy to 0 and decrease perception. Reduces Stamina and Stamina regeneration by 50% for a whole day.
能量降至0，同时降低感知力。耐力及其恢复速度均降低50%，持续一天。
A gold ring that Margaret gave me as a pledge. It originally belonged to her mother.
一枚原本属于玛格丽特母亲的金戒指，玛格丽特将戒指予我作为誓物。
The key to the shed at the mill.
Soap, a mix of fat, ash, and who knows what else. Combined with water, it works miracles on dirty clothes.
肥皂本质上是脂肪、灰烬和一些不知名物质的混合物。配合净水能发挥神奇的清洁效果。

Soap made according to a secret recipe from the musk of noble war horses, just like Sir Tobias used to sell at his stall in the old days. Cleansing for the mind and body, and great for when you don't want people recognising you by scent.
根据一则秘密配方制成的香皂，该配方亦是贵族战马体香的奥妙所在，托比亚斯爵士的摊位上也曾售卖过这种肥皂。它不仅能够洁净身心，还是遮掩自身气味的好帮手。
A sack of flour, as it was ground in the mill. Now we need to keep it dry and out of reach of rats.
一袋于磨坊中磨好的面粉。现在我们得让它保持干燥，远离老鼠。
Antler pieces, most likely the remnants of a much more formidable hunting trophy. They can be sold or used to mix potions.
鹿茸碎片，可能是一个不错的战利品的碎片。可以卖掉或者用来混合药剂。
A rare stone with supposedly magical powers that can cure poisoning and is even said to bring good luck. But how it ended up in an animal's stomach is a truly disturbing mystery.
一种稀有的石头，据说具有神奇的力量，可以解毒，甚至能带来好运。但它究竟是如何进入动物的胃里的呢？

A thick, yellow to dark green fluid, bitter to the taste, that is formed in the liver, whence it travels via the bile ducts to the small intestine, where it takes part in the digestion process, primarily by helping absorb fats. Suitable for mixing potions.
一种粘稠，黄至深绿的液体，味苦，由肝生成，通过胆管传播到小肠参与消化，主要用于吸收脂肪。适于混合药剂。
Charcoal is wood burnt in kilns by pyrolysis without influx of air. It is used primarily in forges and smelting works, and to a lesser extent in alchemy for its filtration properties.
木炭是木头在无空气流入的炉子中高温燃烧分解而来的。主要用于锻造和熔炼，由于其具有过滤功能，也可以用于炼金。
Charcoal produced in charcoal mills and further leached for a long time to improve its alchemical properties.
木炭厂生产的木炭，经过了长期浸泡以提升其炼金特性。
An essential building feature of every human dwelling and a source of food for spiders and some magical elixirs.
每间房子都会有的东西，也是蜘蛛的食物来源，偶尔还能作为神秘学材料用。

The tanned cowhide is the most common material for all shoemakers and saddlers. Cowhide is used to make good boots, belts, straps, bags and even large saddles. Work with it wisely so that not a single piece goes to waste!
鞣制牛皮是制鞋和制鞍的最常用材料。牛皮可以用来制作优质的靴子、腰带、绑带、袋子甚至大型马鞍。想好怎么用它，可别浪费了！
A well tanned deer skin. Fine and highly prized leather, used for higher quality products and a wealthier clientele.
精心鞣制过的鹿皮，质量上乘，价格高昂。用来制作高质量产品，面向富裕客户。
You shouldn't brag about your own feathers, but this isn't mine. On the other hand, who would I brag to?
你不该炫耀自己的羽毛，但它又不是我的。话说回来，我又该向谁炫耀呢？
Cornucopia. The horns and hooves of animals are traditionally used mainly to make good glue. However, good hornwood is also needed to make bows, crossbows and even some jewellery.
动物的角就是个聚宝盆，一般是用来制作优质胶水的材料，而质量更高的角可以制作弓弩，甚至珠宝。
A human bone chopped with an axe.
一根被斧头劈砍的人骨。
A skull pulled from a pig's innards. It's been chewed on a bit.
猪的胃里取出的颅骨，上面有些被咀嚼过的痕迹。
Rendered lard for various alchemical recipes.
可用于各种炼金配方的熟猪油。

Commonly known as 'fly agaric', this brightly-coloured mushrooms attracts attention, but consuming it is potentially life-threatening! However, in small doses it can provide a variety of effects, which alchemists commonly make use of.
它常见的名字是“毒蝇伞”，色彩鲜艳，引人注目，但吃了很可能会死！不过，在很小的剂量下，它会产生许多效果，经常为炼金术师所用。
A mushroom from a damp cave. It is not advisable to eat it alone, but some alchemical recipes will definitely use it.
潮湿洞穴之中的蘑菇，不建议单独食用。通常当做炼金术的配方材料使用。

It is often used in Christian ceremonies. Incense is mentioned back in the Bible and was used by the ancient Egyptians and later by the Romans. The smoke from this rare plant resin has a soothing effect on the human body, but it can also lift the mood and surprisingly increase attention. Its smoke can make one very dizzy and make dreams seem real. This is also why frankincense is considered a rare magical raw material.
它经常用于基督教仪式中。圣经中提到过这种香料，古埃及人使用过它，后来罗马人也使用过。这种稀有植物树脂产生的烟雾对人体有舒缓作用，但也可以振奋心神，在增强注意力方面有着出人预料的效果。它所产生的烟雾可能让人头晕目眩，使梦境显得更为真实，也因此被视作稀有的魔法材料。

Tanned pork leather. What it loses in natural strength it makes up for in durability and distinctive softness. That's why tailors use it for lining, for finer cases and for book covers. That's the only way it won't tear.
鞣制的猪皮革，虽然在强度上有所欠缺，但具有独特的柔软度和耐用性。通常用来制作衬里、精致箱包和书皮，这样它就不会轻易撕裂了。

Saltpetre is formed by evaporation of leachate from decaying residues, carrion and cattle excrement. It is suitable for smoking meat and is easily recognisable by its cool taste. It is also one of the three secret ingredients for the alchemical preparation of gunpowder.
硝石是通过蒸发腐烂残渣、腐肉或牛粪的浸出液而制成的，适合用来熏肉，会带来一种独特的味道。它也是炼金术中制作火药的三种秘密原料之一。

Yellow nonmetal represents the masculine element in the mystery of alchemy. It is an indispensable material for the manufacture of gunpowder, because it is associated with the principle of combustion.
这种黄色非金属材料在炼金术中代表阳性元素。它也是一种易燃物，是制造火药不可或缺的材料。
Nice trophy from the boar hunt, who knows how many asses this boar's tusk has torn. Suitable for charming the ladies, but also for various elixirs.
一次野猪狩猎中的战利品，谁知道这枚獠牙撕裂过多少猎物的屁股。它适合用来吸引女士的目光，也可以用于制作各种药剂。

The fangs of an adult wolf. In their time, they must have brought down many a doe or sheep, and perhaps even drove some stray unfortunate from the world. Maybe I'll get some coin for them, or I can carry them around for protection. Either way, I should avoid doing any unfair witchcraft with them.
成年狼的獠牙，在它的主人活着的时候，可能猎杀过许多鹿和羊，甚至可能还驱逐过一些不幸的流浪者。它可以用来卖钱，也可以留下防身，但不管怎样，不应该用它进行那些邪恶的巫术。

An extraordinary invention of everyday use, fitted with special glasses in wooden frames. This thing allows scholars and monks who have spent their lives squinting at books to regain the sharpness of their vision.
为日常需求而生的杰出发明，配有木框的特制眼镜。此物可让终日眯眼看书的学者和修士们重获清晰的视力。

Hours and hours spent hunched over drawings take a heavy toll on a person. With lenses like these, however, a master builder won't leave out a single gargoyle, thin curve of a pointed arch, or delicate outline of a pinnacle.
长时间弯腰伏在图纸上对身体造成了很大的伤害。然而，借助如此镜片，建筑大师就不会遗漏任何一个石雕怪兽和尖拱细微的雕刻弧度，甚至是在雕刻尖顶的精美轮廓时也不会有所疏忽。
A strong booze will burn away all physical and mental ailments.
烈酒会烧掉所有身体和精神上的病痛。
Fresh milk that farmer Fowl was hiding away.
农夫福尔藏起来的鲜牛奶。
Valuables that someone from Bohunowitz hid in a pigeon coop.
来自博胡诺维茨的不明人士藏于鸽子笼里的贵重物品。
I wonder what this opens? And why was it hidden?
它能打开什么？为什么要被藏起来？
The ring I found hidden in the fake grave. It doesn't look very expensive, but it's certainly worth something.
我在假坟墓里找到的戒指。看起来并不昂贵，但肯定值点钱。
Medallion with the Virgin Mary belonging to the villager Willow from Bohunowitz.
带有圣母玛利亚画像的徽章，属于博胡诺维茨的村民温洛。
A book by the Wysoka parish priest. So many years he spent working on it…
一位维索卡牧师撰写的书籍，他花费了多年时间才完成此书......
High quality shoes by cobbler Vejmola.
鞋匠维约莫拉制作的高品质鞋履。
A simple silver ring I nearly chipped a tooth on, because some mad old woman from Wysoka accidentally baked it into one of her sweet rolls.
一枚普通的银戒指，但因为不知哪个维索卡的疯老太太不小心把它烤进了甜面包里，差点崩掉我的牙。
A rosary embedded with a precious gem. May God forgive me for my vanity.
镶有宝石的念珠，愿上帝原谅我的虚荣。
The Vejmola's medallion. It flashes so brightly that no magpie can resist it.
维约莫拉的奖章，闪闪发光，是喜鹊的最爱。
The key to the Vejmola's house.
Riding spurs, also called rowels, help control the horse when riding fast or in the heat of battle. Their purpose is of course not to torment the animal, the individual spikes are therefore blunted.
马刺，又称为马靴钉，可在马匹疾驰时或是战斗中起到控制马匹的效果。当然，它并非用于折磨马匹，因此每一段钉刺均已被磨钝。
A human thigh bone, or femur in Latin.
人类的大腿骨，在拉丁语中叫“femur”。
Dust you are and to dust you shall return. The skull serves as a reminder of the transience of human life.
“尘归尘，土归土”。这颗头骨在提醒你，人生苦短。
That must have been torture live.
那一定是一首折磨人的小曲。
That must have been living agony.
那一定是一首折磨人的小曲。
That must have been a torture live.
那一定是一首折磨人的小曲。
The key to the cellar door.
A parchment with drawings of thieves' symbols and explanatory notes.
一张画有盗贼符号及其解释的羊皮纸。
A crumpled parchment with strange symbols drawn on it.
一张皱巴巴的羊皮纸，上面画着奇怪的符号。
The key to the house where von Aulitz is staying.
If it wasn't for this sword, my parents would have still been alive. I'm not sure I even want to carry it.
要不是因为这把剑，我的父母现在依然安在。也不知我还该不该将它带在身边。
一把打开布拉班特箱子的钥匙。
Samuel's hunting sword that never leaves his hand.
塞缪尔的狩猎剑，从未离开过他的双手。
When working hard in the fields, men and women protect themselves from the sun by wearing straw or wicker hats.
在田里辛苦劳作时，人们会戴上草帽或藤帽来防晒。
When working hard in the fields, men and women protect themselves from the sun by wearing straw or wicker hats. This one is a bit narrower, but it serves its purpose just as well.
在田里辛苦工作时，人们会戴上草帽或藤帽来防晒。这顶帽子稍微窄一点，但同样能起到作用。

When working hard in the fields, men and women protect themselves from the sun by wearing straw or wicker hats. This one is definitely past its prime, though. It looks as if the wearer was chewed up by a goat.
在田里辛苦工作时，人们会戴上草帽或藤帽来防晒。不过，这顶帽子显然用得太久了，它看起来像是被山羊啃过一样。
When working hard in the fields, men and women protect themselves from the sun by wearing straw or wicker hats. Decorated with a ribbon, such headgear certainly looks more cheerful.
在田里辛苦劳作时，人们会戴上草帽或藤帽来防晒。这顶帽子饰有丝带，看起来显得更为欢快。
The wind was rough, it made her cough, she coughed until her hat blew ough.
风很大，吹得她咳嗽，她一直在咳嗽，最后连帽子也飞了。
"This broth's so strong it could wake up the dead."
“这汤浓得连死人闻到都会睁眼。”
Some moonshine the Moravians brought to the Semine wedding.
一些摩拉维亚人带到塞米婚宴上的私酿酒。

Various leftovers from cooking all those delicacies for the wedding. It's just enough as a beggar's alms, but the Semine cook is saving it for leaner times. She's definitely against letting it be eaten by the riffraff.
婚宴佳肴结束后的残羹剩饭，几乎只能用来施舍给乞丐，但塞米的厨娘依然将其保存，以备不时之需。她决不允许这些食物被下等人糟蹋。
A simple but truly beautiful gold ring with which Chamberlain Ulrich wanted to bribe Enneleyn at young lord Semine's wedding.
一枚简单但非常漂亮的金戒指，这本来是乌尔里希管家想在塞米少爷的婚礼上给恩内琳的贿赂。
A plain and shabby copper ring.
一枚老旧且平平无奇的铜制戒指。

Necklace for the winner of the swordfighting tournament at the Semine's wedding. Gnarly was right that Lord Semine really had to pay a big money. Maybe he didn't believe anyone but his son Olda could win the tournament.
奖给塞米婚宴上剑术比武胜者的项链。格纳利说得对，塞米领主确实花了大手笔。也许他认为只有他的儿子奥达能赢下比试。
A discarded collar from a horse's harness. With it, a dog might find a trace of the horse it belonged to.
从马具上扔掉的项圈。狗可以通过它追寻到马的踪迹。
A secret player mark to enter the lair of the All Saints.
进入圣徒酒馆下方窝点所需的秘密标记。
The standard of the miners from the St. Anthony's mine in Kuttenberg. Such a standard is the symbol and the pride of every miners' gang!
来自库滕堡圣安东尼矿场的矿工旗帜，这种旗帜是每个矿工队伍的象征和骄傲！
The key to the cellar of the All Saints tavern.
An older form of a knight's sword. Slightly heavier at the tip, therefore best suited for fighting slower, heavily armoured foes.
一种样式古旧的骑士剑。剑尖略重，适合对付那些装甲沉重，行动缓慢的敌人。

A short sword that is said to have been given its special name because of its origin. Whether it really originated in the Swiss city of Basel is questionable, but it is certainly a great weapon that can be carried, unlike the sword, even by non-noble townspeople.
这种短剑据说得名于它们的发源地，但是否真的起源于瑞士城市巴塞尔目前尚存疑问。但它确实是优秀的武器，贵族和平民都可以携带。
The sword worned by Vauquelin Brabant. Although he had been looking for opportunities all his life, for him, their window had closed for good.
瓦奎林·布拉班特的佩剑。尽管他毕生都在寻求机遇，但是机会之窗早已永久紧闭。
A light sword with a wide blade and a thin tip, it stings like a wasp sting.
一把剑刃宽而剑尖细的轻剑，用起来像黄蜂的刺一般凶猛。
A sword for the noble and those who think they can pass themselves off as such. Its beauty slightly exceeds its combat qualities, but it is still a superb weapon.
适合贵族（或者冒充贵族的人）佩戴的长剑，比起战斗性能更注重美观，但依然是实用的好武器。
A dreadful skull opener or a mere result of the tortured mind of a clumsy journeyman who abused the blacksmith's craft to create such wickedness and called it a hunting sword?
是一把可怕的开颅刀，还是一个笨拙的学徒滥用铁匠工艺创造出的，号称匕首的邪恶产物？
A good weapon that any average blacksmith can forge. It's not bad, but at the same time it's not surprising.
一把不错的武器，一般的铁匠都会锻造。不算差，但也不是特别出彩。
A strange little bottle made of coloured glass, the kind that is definitely not made anywhere nowadays. It's probably a very old object, but it's hard to say where it came from.
一个由彩色玻璃制成的奇怪小瓶，现在绝对没有地方会制造这种瓶子了。它可能度过了相当长久的岁月，但很难分辨它来自哪里。
Antique coins with latin writing bearing the resemblances of pagan emperors from ancient Rome.
带有拉丁文的古币，其上印有古罗马的异教帝王。
This head carved out marble must have fallen off a statue. Its strange features and remnants of old paint suggest it's quite old.
这个大理石做的头部一定是从哪个雕像上掉下来的。奇特的面部特征和残留的旧颜料表明它的年代相当久远。
The key to a chest in the rebels' camp.
A hat pulled off the head of the bandit Eggman. Fortunately it doesn't smell as bad as he does...
从土匪鸡蛋佬头顶取走的帽子，好在这顶帽子不像他本人一样臭......
A mace of the leader of the bandits from the Troskowitz gorge. A crude weapon that cracked many a skull and was never properly wiped clean afterwards.
特罗斯科维茨峡谷土匪首领的狼牙棒。这是一种粗制武器，曾击碎过许多头骨，但从未被彻底擦拭干净。
A shield with the symbol of the infamous bandit, Johnny the Gob.
一面印有令人闻风丧胆的杀手“大嘴”约翰尼之纹章的盾牌。
A ring I got from a bandit named Casper.
从一个名叫卡斯帕的强盗那里得到的戒指。
A beautiful hat I picked up from a bandit called Handsome Charlie.
我从一个叫英俊查理的强盗那里捡来的一顶漂亮的帽子。
A silver ring from Captain Barnabas.
一枚来自巴纳比队长的银戒指。

A tiny fragment of bone, which is said to have come from the hand of St. Maurice, is certainly a very precious holy relic. In ancient times, Saint Maurice was the commander of a Roman legion that was decimated by the Emperor for refusing to sacrifice to pagan gods before battle. The martyr is the patron saint of soldiers, weavers, armourers and the protector of vine. This bone may indeed be genuine, as the entire arm was once brought back by the Czech King Vladislav II and later distributed to many Czech churches.
一小块骨头，据说是圣莫里斯的手骨，是十分珍贵的圣物。在古代，圣莫里斯是一位罗马军团的指挥官，因为他拒绝在战斗前向异教神灵献祭，被皇帝处决。这位殉道者是士兵、织工、铸甲师的守护圣人，也是葡萄藤的保护者。而这块骨头可能确实是真品，因为捷克国王弗拉迪斯拉夫二世曾将圣莫里斯的整条手臂带回捷克，并将这些遗骨分发给了许多捷克教堂。

A small fragment of flat bone said to come from the skull of Saint Margaret. In ancient times, the Roman Emperor persecuted all Christians and had many of them cruelly martyred. Margaret was reported by her spurned suitor to the prefect, accusing her of secretly professing faith in Christ. In prison, the devil himself appeared to the virtuous maiden in the form of a dragon and devoured her, but she overcame him with the help of the cross. She survived drowning and burning by fire, so they finally had to behead her. A few relics of this martyr were supposedly given to the Czech King Premysl Otakar by the Pope himself after his victory over the Hungarians.

一小块扁骨，据说是圣玛格丽特头骨的一部分。在古代，罗马皇帝对所有的基督教徒进行迫害，惨无人道地处决了不计其数的教徒。玛格丽特的追求者因遭到拒绝，便向掌权者举报了玛格丽特，指控她私下宣称对基督教的信奉。身处监狱的玛格丽特，遇到了化身恶龙的恶魔本体，后者欲要将她吞噬，好在这位高洁的少女在十字架的帮助下战胜了恶魔。即便遭受冷水淹没、历经烈火焚烧，她依然幸存了下来，所以人们最终只得将她斩首。有传闻称，在战胜匈牙利人后，教皇亲自把这位殉道之人的遗物交给了捷克国王普热米斯尔·欧塔卡拉。

A tiny fragment of St Catherine's fingernail wrapped in embroidered linen. Princess Catherine of Egypt was martyred by the Roman Emperor for her unwavering faith in Christ. It was a terrible torture. The martyr was tied between two spiked wheels and torn alive. But God intervened and destroyed the hideous machine, and Catherine had to be beheaded with a sword. The pious Emperor Charles IV enforced the feast of this martyr in the Bohemian kingdom because he believed she had helped him turn the hopeless course of the Battle of San Felice into a glorious victory.

一小块由绣花亚麻布包裹着的手指甲，该指甲源自圣凯瑟琳。因对基督教有着坚定不移的信仰，埃及的凯瑟琳公主曾被罗马帝王以异教徒之罪处死。那是一场惨绝人寰的折磨，殉道者被绑在两个带刺的轮子之间，要被活活撕裂。但是，上帝介入了这场处刑，毁掉了那台令人胆寒的刑器，因此凯瑟琳不得被斩首示众。后来，虔诚的查理四世皇帝在波希米亚王国为这位殉道之人举办节日，因为他相信，是凯瑟琳为原本希望渺茫的圣菲利斯之战带来了光荣的胜利。

A tiny fragment from the veil of Saint Ludmila is a piece of very fine batiste. Ludmila prayed sincerely to Christ and brought her grandson, Prince Wenceslas, the patron saint of the Bohemian Kingdom, to faith. But she stood in the way of her power-hungry daughter-in-law Drahomira, who sent two cruel Norsemen to kill her. It is said they did it to her with her own veil while the duchess was praying to God.
这块精细的薄布是圣卢德米拉面纱的残片。卢德米拉是虔诚的基督徒，并引导她的孙子，即后来的波希米亚的守护圣人瓦茨拉夫王子皈依基督教。但这阻碍了她儿媳德侯米娅贪婪的权力欲，于是德侯米娅派出了两个残忍的北欧刺客，他们在卢德米拉夫人向上帝祈祷时，用她自己的面纱勒死了她。

These few strands of hair are said to have belonged to Saint Barbara, who was cruelly punished by her pagan father for accepting faith in Christ. As she fled from him, she hid in a rock crevice, which is why today she is the patron saint of all miners. Only a certain shepherd revealed her hiding place to her pursuers, and the young maiden was captured and cruelly tortured into renouncing her faith. Finally, after she was whipped and her breasts were cut off, she was led naked to the execution block where she was beheaded by her own father.
据说这几缕头发属于圣芭芭拉，她因信仰基督而遭受异教徒父亲的残酷惩罚。她逃离她的父亲时，藏在了一个岩缝之中，因此她如今成了为矿工的守护圣人。后来一个牧羊人向追捕者出卖了她的藏身处，于是这位年轻的少女落入了异教徒之手。他们对她严刑拷打以让她放弃信仰，但她宁死不从。最后，她饱经鞭打并被切掉乳房后，被赤身裸体带上了刑场，在那里被她的父亲斩首。
The contract between the Knight Taras Mura and Father Richard from Old Kutna.
骑士塔拉斯·穆拉和老库特纳的理查德神父之间的契约。
Notes of the knight Taras Mura, found in the mines near Old Kutna.
在老库特纳附近的矿井中发现的骑士塔拉斯·穆拉的笔记。
Notes of Knight Taras Mura, found in the mines near Old Kutna.
在老库特纳附近的矿井中发现的骑士塔拉斯·穆拉的笔记。
Notes of the knight Taras Mura, found in the mines near Old Kutna.
在老库特纳附近的矿井中发现的骑士塔拉斯·穆拉的笔记。
Sir Taras Mura's notes, found in the mines near Old Kutna.
塔拉斯·穆拉爵士的笔记，发现于老库特纳附近的矿井中。
A handful of food for the mine demon.
一把献祭给矿坑恶魔的食物。
A key found on the body of a knight in the mines near Old Kutna.
在老库特纳矿井附近的一具骑士尸体身上发现的钥匙。

Placeholder. A test sword with a really long name. A test sword with a really long name. A test sword with a really long name. A test sword with a really long name. Test sword with a really long name. Test sword with a really long name. Test sword with a really long name.
占位符。测试剑名字很长。测试剑名字很长。测试剑名字很长。测试剑名字很长。测试剑名字很长。测试剑名字很长。测试剑名字很长。
May it be a light for you in dark places, when all other lights go out.
若光明不再，愿它做你在黑暗中的一盏明灯。

A beautiful sword of the highest quality, the ultimate master weapon! It was made by Enderlin, a swordsman from Kuttenberg, as a copy of the sword of the Kuttenberg swordfighting guild. For the greater glory of Kuttenberg, Master Enderlin then donated it as a reward for the winners of the Kuttenberg Tournament.
一把品质绝佳的精美宝剑，堪称终极大师武器！此剑由库滕堡的剑客恩德林打造而成，是库滕堡剑术行会剑的复制品。以敬库滕堡的至高荣耀，恩德林大师将其捐赠而出，作为给予库滕堡比武大赛获胜者的奖赏。
An excellent mace, which serves more as a symbol of a strict ruler over the tournament than for fighting.
一把精良的狼牙棒，更像是作为比武大会严苛规则的象征，而非简单用于战斗。
Shield made for the Kuttenberg tournament. Compared to a regular shield it is considerably lighter, which is of course compensated by its durability.
为库滕堡比武大会特制的盾牌。与普通盾牌相比，此盾显得更为轻便，当然，代价就是折损的耐用性。
Key to the chest with the explosive barrel.
装有火药桶的箱子钥匙。
A keg filled to the lid with black powder. I shouldn't walk close to a fire with it.
装满黑火药的桶，切记远离火源。
A document in which Eldris, the gun forger, records the supply routes of gunpowder.
枪匠埃尔德里斯记录火药供应路线的文件。
A map to a site where there's treasure.
一张标记了藏宝地点的地图。
A map to a site where there's treasure.
一张标记了藏宝地点的地图
A map to a site where there's treasure.
一张标记了藏宝地点的地图。
A map to a site where there's treasure.
一张标记了藏宝地点的地图。
A tasty freshwater fish, abundant in flowing waters such as rivers and streams. Suitable to be fried, roasted or added to a soup.
一种美味的淡水鱼，大量出没于河流和小溪等流动的水域，是油炸、烤制或作为汤料的绝佳食材。
Tasty freshwater fish prepared with butter and herbs. It's simply a fairy tale.
加入了黄油和香草制成的淡水鱼，如童话般美味。
Dried trout must be seasoned well, then it is a long-lasting delicacy.
如果调味得当，会成为保存良久的美味佳肴。
Smoked trout is not as tasty as freshly baked, but it definitely lasts longer and is still better than dried.
熏鳟鱼的味道不如现烤的，但保存的时间很长，而且比风干的更好吃。

The lower linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as an essential part of their clothing. Of course, if you're not exactly a craftsman at work, it's polite to complement it with a woollen outer garment.
内层亚麻束腰外衣是富人和穷人都必备的衣物。当然，如果你并非正在劳作的工匠，那还是搭配一件羊毛外衣更符合礼节。
A long inner tunic joined with butcher's apron.
配有屠夫围裙的长款亚麻束腰外衣。
A long linen tunic joined by a long leather apron for harder work in the workshop.
长款亚麻束腰外衣配长皮围裙，适合在工坊中进行繁重劳动时穿着。
A tunic so worn that it almost falls apart, yet it is often a beggar's only possession.
一件磨损得几乎要支离破碎的束腰外衣，但它常常是乞丐仅剩的财物。
A linen tunic is an essential part of any outfit. The innkeepers also wear a working linen apron around their waists.
亚麻束腰外衣是任何服装的必备部分。酒馆老板还会在腰间系上一条工作用的亚麻围裙。
An inner linen tunic is a good base for any outfit. This one's a bit worn out.
内穿的亚麻束腰外衣是一切装扮的打底优选。这件是有些老旧了。
A short linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as a base for the rest of the outfit.
短款亚麻束腰外衣，富人与穷人均会穿戴，作为其它衣物的打底衫。
Short linen tunic with linen apron.
配有亚麻围裙的短款亚麻束腰外衣。
A short linen tunic complete with a butcher's apron.
一件短款亚麻束腰外衣，配有一条屠夫围裙。
A short linen tunic, dirty and ragged that only a beggar would wear it.
短亚麻束腰外衣，又脏又破，只有乞丐才会穿。
An exquisite quilted tunic of a papal legate, a perfect example of the mastery of the Italian masters of the sharp needle.
教皇特使穿着的精美绗缝束腰外衣，是意大利针线大师手艺的完美典范。
A short linen tunic joined with a leather apron for harder work in the workshop.
短款亚麻束腰外衣配皮围裙，适合在工坊中进行繁重劳动时穿着。
Short linen tunic with a simple miner's shirt for working in the mines.
短款亚麻束腰外衣，配有简单的矿工衬衫，适合在矿场工作时穿戴。
The Pourpoint is a handsome waist-length quilted coat, often worn by wealthier townspeople.
此棉衣优雅秀丽，是件环腰的绗缝外套，通常由较富裕的城镇居民穿着。
Extended linen tunic with delicate embroidered trimmed hems.
加长的亚麻束腰外衣，边缘饰有精美的刺绣。
It is palatable to the simple peasants, the poor and the cattle. The nobility often turn up their noses at it, but they do not know what they are missing.
对农民、穷人和牲畜来说十分美味，贵族却常对此食物嗤之以鼻，但那些贵族真不知道自己错过了什么。
Knight Florian's unfinished poem for an unknown lady.
弗洛里安骑士为一位不知名女士写下的未尽诗篇。
This is a unique clothing asset for an important character. If you got it in game, report it!
这是一个重要角色的独有服装。如果你在游戏中得到了它，请报告给我们！

Full arm and forearm protection with gilded shoulder pads in the form of targets. This is simply the pinnacle of knightly handsomeness. According to legend, it belonged to the Bohemian Prince Brunswick.
此护甲可为手臂和前臂提供完整的保护，配有镀金的护肩，形如标靶。此护甲简直就是骑士风范的巅峰，且据说它曾属于波希米亚王子布伦瑞克。
铁匠奥西纳的箱子钥匙。
The silver ring of Knight Florian Lomnicz, which he received from a young lady as a token of her favour.
弗洛里安·洛姆尼茨骑士的银戒指，这是他从一位年轻女士那里收到的爱情信物。
Letter of nobility with the seal and signature of the lord of Straz with a commission for the Captain Dub.
寄给杜布队长的授权信，带有斯特拉兹领主的印章和签名。
Vassal letter with the seal of the lord von Bergow for Hanko Goathead, the bailiff of Turnau.
封有冯·波尔高领主印章的封臣信函，写给图尔瑙的执行官“山羊头”汉科。
A Vassal charter from Lord von Bergow for the the Großskal custodian Otte Koch.
冯·波尔高领主写给格罗斯卡尔（Groß Skal）领地看守人奥特·科赫的封臣信函
Good red wine for Lord Capon. The road to Nebakov will be long and one's throat can dry up during the siege of the castle.
给卡蓬大人准备的上好的葡萄酒。前往内巴科夫的路途漫长，围城期间他们会口渴的。
Supposedly a magical amulet of a nomadic foreman, which guarantees invulnerability and resistance to all diseases.
据说是一位游民首领的魔法护符，能使人刀枪不入且可抵御所有疾病。
Veils, or also veils or shawls belong to the everyday clothing of married and widowed women. They are most often white or light-coloured and are fastened with pins and brooches.
面纱，也称为头巾或披肩，是已婚妇女和寡妇日常打扮的一部分。通常为白或浅色，由别针和胸针固定。
A women's hood covers the head, chest and shoulders. It protects from the cold and unwelcome stares.
女用兜帽，覆盖了头部、胸部和肩膀。它既能防寒，又能遮挡不怀好意的目光。
Wearing covered hair by married women is not just a matter of Christian tradition. Jewish women are also required by halakha to wear scarves or hats covering their hair after marriage.
已婚女性佩戴遮盖头发的头饰不只是基督教的传统议题。据犹太习俗约束，犹太妇女也被要求在婚后佩戴头巾或是帽子，以此遮盖头发。
Veils, or also wimples belong to the everyday clothing of married and widowed women. They are most often white or light-coloured and are fastened with pins and brooches.
面纱，也称为修女头巾，是已婚妇女和寡妇日常打扮的一部分。通常为白或浅色，由别针和胸针固定。
A colorful scarf will keep not only the hair off your forehead, but also a bit of coin. Sometimes it can also serve as a gift for a loved one.
色彩缤纷的围巾，不仅能将额头上的头发挡开，还能为你省下点钱。有时，它还能成为送给爱人的好礼。
Veils, or also wimples belong to the everyday clothing of married and widowed women. They are most often white or light-coloured and are fastened with pins and brooches.
面纱，也称为修女头巾，是已婚妇女和寡妇日常打扮的一部分。通常为白或浅色，由别针和胸针固定。
A work scarf hides the hair and protects it from dirt. According to the custom of the time, married women should not appear in public without their hair covered.
工作头巾，可遮盖头发，使其免受尘沙影响。根据当时的习俗，已婚女性不可在公共场合露出头发。
A festive beech leaf wreath is designed for big days, such as the wedding day.
一顶节庆榉树叶花环，专为重大时日而生，比如婚礼。
A diary of dreams of Otto von Bergow.
记录了奥托·冯·波尔高梦境的日记
Various ailments and their herbal treatment.
记载了各种疾病及其草药疗法。
A ring given to me by Godwin. He said that if I meet someone named Oderin, I should show him the ring. Who knows what Godwin's up to now?
古德温交给我的一枚戒指。他说，如果我遇到了名为奥德林的人，就把戒指给他看看，也不知古德温在盘算着什么。
A bundle of dried herbs from Victoria's house.
维多利亚家的一捆干草药。
A nicely decorated piece of good fabric.
一块由优质布料制成的精美围巾。
The helmet of the notorious murderer and bandit Burkhard.
臭名昭著的杀人犯和强盗布克哈德的头盔。

The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment, usually linen, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.
军服是一种宽松外衣，材质通常为亚麻，穿着于盔甲之外。它染饰着领主、城镇或穿戴者效忠的统治者的配色，而它正是现代军装的前身。如此衣物同样可保护穿戴者免受尘沙与烈阳的侵扰。
Battle waffenrock, which was lent to me as part of my equipment for the Kuttenberg tournament.
一件借来的战斗用军服，是我参与库滕堡比武大会时使用的装备。
The Polner family of Kuttenberg is wealthy enough to afford a small military retinue. These soldiers then wear their coat of arms, mainly for reasons of prestige.
库滕堡的波尔纳家族非常富有，可以雇佣一小群军队扈从作为护卫。而这些士兵们则穿戴着印有波尔纳家族纹章的衣物，以示家族威望。
A waffenrock bearing the symbol of the Order of the Crusaders of the Red Star.
印有红星十字骑士团标志的军服。
This waffenrock makes it clear to everyone where your allegiance lies!
这件军服清晰地表明了你的忠诚所在！
Flour, butter, honey, salt, egg yolk, cream, walnuts… and the miracle is done. It just melts on the tongue, tastes great whether hot or cold.
用面粉、黄油、蜂蜜、盐、蛋黄、奶油、核桃......然后奇迹般的甜点就出现了。入口即化，无论冷热都美味无比。
Eating walnuts helps keep your nerves strong and your mind sharp. It's no coincidence their kernels look like that thing you carry around in your head.
吃核桃有助于保持神经健康，头脑敏锐，核桃仁长得像大脑可不只是巧合。
Steel chanfron in the shape of a dragon's head with eye protection and a simple bridle. In battle it makes the animal much braver, but in gallop it slightly slows down the horse.
龙头形状的钢制马头甲，配有护眼器具和简易马勒。能让战斗中的马匹更加勇敢，但会略微降低马匹的奔跑速度。
Solid chanfron forged from one piece of polished steel. Includes bridle with decorated cheekpieces. It gives the animal courage and slightly slows it down while galloping.
由抛光钢铁锻造而成的坚固马头甲。此物配有缰绳以及装饰性颊片，可赋予马匹勇气，但会略微降低奔跑速度。
Robust chanfron forged from one piece of polished steel. Includes a crenellated bridle. It gives the animal courage and slightly slows it down while galloping.
由抛光钢铁锻造而成的坚固马头甲。此物配有齿状缰绳，可赋予马匹勇气，但会略微降低奔跑速度。

The war hammer is considered by many to be as noble a weapon as the sword, since it is used where there is no room for swordplay and hard blows need to be dealt. The war hammer is therefore designed to penetrate armour and crush bones in the heat of battle.
许多人都认为战锤和剑一样，均是一种高贵的武器，因为它会在没有施展剑术空间的情况下使用，且需要使出重击。因此，在激烈的战斗中，战锤就专门用于击破盔甲，或让人粉身碎骨。
A hammer made for killing trolls. These monsters are said to hide under bridges and ambush unsuspecting travellers and caravans. Or maybe it's just an excuse for bandits.
这是一把专为猎杀巨魔而制的锤子。据说这些怪物藏在桥下，伏击毫无防备的旅人和商队。又或者这不过是土匪的一个借口而已。
Even a weapon against non-human creatures will eventually be destroyed, even by killing mere humans.
即使是对非人生物使用的武器，最终也会因杀死人类而被毁坏。
A type of war hammer, often called a "raven's beak" for the shape of its spike. While its blunt end is great for crushing skulls, its pointed end is perfect for piercing armour.
一种战锤，因其外形常被称为“乌鸦喙”。战锤钝的一端能击碎头骨，而锋利的尖端能将敌人的铠甲撕裂。

A really heavy war hammer designed to break through knights' armour. It can take a lot, but one has to be skilled with it to make it serve him well. It is used with a shield in a hard melee battle, where there is no telling what blow will fall where.
一把名副其实的重型战锤，专门用于击破骑士的坚甲。它能造成巨大冲击，但使用者必须熟知技巧才可发挥其最大效用。身处激烈近战时，它应与盾牌搭配使用，因为在如此战斗中，刀光剑影皆看不清来去。
A simple wooden saddle with a sheep's wool cushion and a linen seat. It extends the horse's carrying capacity only modestly. But the effect on its speed is also negligible.
简易木制鞍具，配有羊毛垫和亚麻座椅。略微提升马匹的负重能力，但对其速度的影响微乎其微。
Quality solid wood saddle with decorative horn, padded fenders and saddle bags. The generous extension of the carrying capacity brings with it a reduction in the speed of the animal.
优良的硬木鞍具，配有装饰性号角、衬垫蹬革和鞍袋。此物能大幅提升马匹的负重能力，但随之也降低了马匹的速度。

A unique saddle with a significantly extended cantle, decorated fenders and top grain leather saddle bags. However, the generous extension of the carrying capacity brings with it a reduction in the speed of the animal.
一种独特马鞍，鞍尾显著延长，配有装饰性蹬革和顶级皮革鞍袋。此物能大幅提升马匹的负重能力，但随之也降低了马匹的速度。
Watermelon, the biggest berry to be found in the Holy Roman Empire.
西瓜，神圣罗马帝国找到的最大的浆果。
The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful, now it's useless.
一把武器的残骸，也曾叱咤沙场，现已油尽灯枯。
In Jitschine, they brew a thick full-bodied beer that will satisfy every lover of the golden beverage.
在吉钦，人们酿造了一种口感醇厚浓郁的啤酒，可以满足每位爱好者对这款金色饮品的渴望。
Turnau beer is known far and wide for its light taste and fruity aroma. An expert will recognise the lower bitterness and fermentation.
图尔瑙啤酒以其清淡的口感和果香味而闻名，品酒专家能辨认出它那浅浅的苦涩味和发酵感。
Weak beer with no taste, almost indistinguishable from muddy pond water.
没味道的啤酒，像是在喝泥水。
A festive beer brewed for the Semine wedding. Full-bodied flavour with a dominant bitterness and honey aftertaste.
为塞米婚宴酿制的节庆啤酒，口感浓郁，带有明显的苦味和蜂蜜的回甘。
Excellent wine, the consumption of which can lead to fun, song, drunken blabbering, loss of memory and empty purses.
优质的葡萄酒，喝了它会让你欢乐、唱歌、酒后胡言乱语、断片以及空空的钱包。
Grapes of wine growing on a rose bush! Tastes miraculously and increases your health!
和玫瑰花一同生长的葡萄，味道美妙无比，而且有益健康！
A bitter young wine. Though it may not be the tastiest beverage, it'll still wash away all your troubles.
一瓶苦涩的新酿葡萄酒，虽然它可能不是最美味的，但足以抹去你所有的烦恼。
A quality wine harvested in late autumn, full of flavour and beautifully coloured.
深秋酿成的美酒，风味浓郁，色泽艳丽。
The cream of Loretz vineyards and the pride of Kuttenberg burghers. People say it doesn't give a hangover.
洛雷兹葡萄园的精华，库滕堡市民的骄傲，据说它从来不会让人宿醉。
Wolf heart may be useful for some evil sorcery, but a true Christian should not eat such a thing even if he were starving.
狼心对邪恶的巫术来说很有用处，但对真正的基督徒而言，哪怕真的很饿也不该吃这种东西。

Only eat wolf meat in an emergency and always keep it in flames for a long time beforehand so that all the evil is burned away. Also, you must never eat too much of it, for then you may become afflicted by a bad disease or a cruel curse.
人们在紧急情况下才会选择吃狼肉，而且吃之前需要经过长时间的火烤从而去除其中的邪恶。此外，切勿过量食用，否则会患上疾病，或者遭受残酷的诅咒。
Wearing a wreath is the domain of single women. But it can look nice on a bachelor, too.
穿戴花环通常是单身女性的专属，但单身汉戴起来看着也不赖。
Some concoction that Olbram gave me. If I put it in Alshik's food, it should really send him running…
奥尔布拉姆给我的某种药剂。如果把它加进阿尔希克的食物里，他应该会立刻跑进厕所……
A wreath from the top of the Tachov maypole. It was the pride of the whole village up until recently, but now I have it. I reckon it'll be used as decoration in Olbram's cottage soon enough.
从塔霍夫的五朔节花柱上取下的花环，直到最近，它还是整个村庄的骄傲，但现在它归我所有。之后可以拿来装饰奥尔布拉姆的小屋。
A beautiful hunting bow, given to me by Hans Capon as thanks for rescuing him from captivity at Maleshov fortress.
一把精美的猎弓。汉斯·卡蓬为感谢我在马列索夫堡垒将他救出，便将这把弓赠予了我。
The key to a chest holding thieves' equipment.
装有盗贼装备的箱子钥匙。
Key to the entrance of the great tower at Maleshov fortress.
打开马列索夫堡垒塔楼入口的钥匙。
Key to the noble chambers in the Maleshov fortress.
打开马列索夫堡垒中贵族房间的钥匙。
I have the key. The question is what door it opens, what lies behind it, and whether it is wise to find out.
我有钥匙，但这钥匙能打开哪扇门？门后又隐藏着什么？我该探索这隐藏的秘密吗？
A sketch of the Maleshov fortress, given to me by Rosa Ruthard.
马列索夫要塞的地图，是罗莎·鲁瑟德交给我的。
Sketch of the interior of the tower at Maleshov Fortress given to me by Rosa Ruthard
马列索夫要塞塔楼的地图，由罗莎·鲁瑟德交给我的。
Gold decorated book in red leather. Rosa Ruthard asked me to bring her this book from the Maleshov fortress.
一本红色皮革金色装饰的书。罗莎·鲁瑟德让我把这本书从马列索夫要塞带给她。
Wooden statue of an old man, symbolizing the connection with one's ancestors.
木制的老人雕像，象征着与祖先的联系。
A map marking the ambush site, scribbled with charcoal.
一张地图，用木炭涂画出了伏击地点。
A bundle of rare dyed fabrics.
The Semine captain's club looks as crooked and old as he does. So perhaps it'll be just as good at smashing enemies.
塞米队长的棍棒看起来和他本人一样狡诈且年迈，所以没准它也很擅长击溃敌人。
The faithful companion of Captain Gnarly.
格纳利队长最忠实的伙伴。
An old quilted coat that has been stitched a hundred times and also sewn a hundred times.
老旧的绗缝外套，已被缝补百次。
The old helmet of captain Gnarly. It's got holes, but it'll provide some protection. And if not, it'll at least serve as a colander.
格纳利队长的老旧头盔。盔有凹洞，但仍可提供些许防护，要不就把它当成个滤锅来用。
About abominable poisons, their acquisition, and the art of stopping the effects caused by them.
介绍了令人厌恶的毒药，讲解了制毒与解毒的方法。
I wonder where the other one is?
You need to keep track of money. Especially the money we don't have.
你需要记录所有资金来往，尤其是那些还没到我们手里的钱。
The key to a painted chest in which the lost charter of the Prague soldiers is hidden.
一把上漆箱子的钥匙，里面藏有布拉格士兵遗失的特许状。
Key to Musa's chest in the military camp.
It may look ordinary, but it has ripped open a very important belly.
它或许看起来平平无奇，但曾撕开了一个重要人士的肚子。
Some write poems out of love, others steal shoes…
有人为爱作诗，有些人却去偷鞋……
Zizka's stuff. There's a lot of rattling and ringing, so it's probably not a butterfly collection.
杰式卡的东西，里面叮叮当当的，大概不是蝴蝶标本。
A basket full of thread, needles and pieces of embroidered designs.
装满针线和一些刺绣图案的篮子。
Gold ring set with a small polished sapphire.
镶有小型抛光蓝宝石的金戒指。
This yellowed rag which smells of sweat and fish, is probably used by Vojta as a scarf.
这条黄色破布散发着汗臭与鱼臭，沃伊塔似乎将它用作围巾。
Empty waterskin of the hunter Vostatek. It reeks of an undetermined alcohol.
猎人沃斯塔克的空水袋，散发着不知什么酒的酒精味。
Vostatek the gamekeeper's waterskin filled with pure spring water… or perhaps diluted with something.
猎人沃斯塔克的水袋里装满了纯净的泉水……也有可能是稀释过的其他东西。
The old bridle of Vostatek's horse Pepik. If I could teach Mutt to track and give him a sniff of the bridle, I'm sure he'd lead me to him.
沃斯塔克的马佩皮克的旧缰绳。如果我能教会呆呆追踪，那么让它闻闻这个缰绳就能带我找到佩皮克了。
Part of the armour of Sir Jezhek of Holohlavy.
霍洛拉维的杰泽克爵士护甲的一部分。
A Caparison in the colours of the Lords of Holohlavy.
霍洛拉维领主配色的马衣。
A cuirass bearing the coat of arms of Sir Jezhek of Holohlavy.
印有霍洛拉维的杰泽克爵士纹章的胸甲。
Part of Sir Jezhek of Holohlavy's armour.
霍洛拉维的杰泽克爵士盔甲的一部分。
Part of the armour of Sir Jezhek of Holohlavy.
霍洛拉维的杰泽克爵士护甲的一部分。
Part of the armour of Sir Jezhek of Holohlavy.
霍洛拉维的杰泽克爵士护甲的一部分。
They symbolize everything that makes a knight a knight.
它们象征着骑士应有的一切特质。
Waffenrock bearing the coat of arms of the Lords of Garbow.
印有加博领主纹章的军服。
A heater shield with the family coat of arms of the lord of Holohlavy.
印有霍洛拉维领主之家纹的斗盾。
一把打开扎维什箱子的钥匙。
This moonshine can get cause you a lot of trouble, and not just an upset stomach.
这种私酿酒会给你带来很多麻烦，不仅限于胃部不适。
A memento of Agnes and Olda's big day. Using it allows you to reroll up to three dice. Can be used once per game.
用于纪念阿格尼丝和奥达盛大婚礼的徽章。使用后可在某次掷骰时重掷最多三枚骰子。每局游戏可使用一次。
You double the score of your turn. Can be used once per game.
你可以将上一轮的分数翻倍。每局游戏可使用1次
Used to gain a quarter more points from your turn. Can be used once per game.
将本轮的分数增加1/4。每局游戏可使用1次。
Using this badge will grant you 50% more points this round. Can be used once per game.
使用此徽章可在该回合获得50%的额外分数。每局游戏可使用一次。
弗洛里安崇拜者的来信
Livre du ciel et du monde
来自斯卡利茨的斧头残骸
配有宽型保护片的钢盔
带有字母铭文的黄铜胸针
Caparison of the Lords of Leipa
Caparison of the Lord of Semine
The hose of a royal waiter
Mail hood with a coat of arms
苏霍茨基的彼得的胸甲
Moglen saddle of poor quality leather
劣质皮革制成的莫格伦马鞍
卡斯帕葡萄园的葡萄酒
酒馆老板哈维尔的账本
布谢克爵士的酿酒智慧
克里斯蒂安的安全通行证
前往秘密铸币厂的地图
塞德莱茨停尸间的钥匙
Fable of the Fox and the Pitcher
Excerpt from the Legend of Christianus
Monastic Rule of Saint Benedict I
Monastic Rule of Saint Benedict II
On the Adamites or Naked Worshippers
The Czech Campaign to Lombardy I
The Czech Campaign to Lombardy II
The New Council by Smil Flashka of Pardubice
《新议会》帕杜比采的史麦尔·弗拉什卡著
On Saint Procopius and foundation of the monastery
《圣普罗科匹厄斯与修道院的由来》
卡雷尔头上取下的箭矢
多萝西的洗衣房箱子钥匙
《赫耳墨斯·特里斯墨吉斯忒斯的报价》
在内巴科夫找到的帽子
Bridle of the Holy Roman Empire
Tournament caparison in colours of Leipa
莱佩家族配色的比武用马衣
Executioner’s caparison in colours of Leipa
莱佩家族配色的侩子手马衣
马科瓦尔·冯·奥利茨的马衣
Copies of the poems of Margrave Prokop
普罗科普侯爵的诗篇抄本
Book on the nobility of the bow
A treatise on the beauty of the crossbow
塞德莱茨箱子中的地图
斯拉戈附近猎物分布地图
沃斯塔克家藏着的地图
普罗科普的首款葡萄酒
安布洛斯的执事任命令
Chronicle of the Knights of the Cross
Old letter about the Order's commandery fire
关于骑士团总部火灾的旧信
Old notes on the fire investigation
意大利宫军械库的钥匙
科帕尼那的偷猎者装备
石塔池塘偷猎者的装备
石塔池塘偷猎者的装备
偷猎者维德拉克的箱子钥匙
维德拉克偷猎者的装备
维德拉克池塘偷猎者的装备
重铸的拉德季·科比拉之剑
Key to the ruins of Slatego
Recipe for Hair o' the Dog
A book by the Wysoka parish priest.
Real documents about Anna of Waldstein
与瓦尔德斯坦的安娜有关的真实文件
Forged documents about Anna of Waldstein
与瓦尔德斯坦的安娜有关的伪造文件
Old Town of Prague knight shield
Order of the cross knight shield
维索卡牧师的炼金术书
鞋匠维约莫拉制作的优质鞋
马科瓦尔·冯·奥利茨的长剑
Key to the Cellar of All Saints' tavern.
打开圣徒酒馆地窖的钥匙。
埃尔德里斯关于火药供应的笔记
Nobleman's letter of the Captain Dub
寄给杜布队长的贵族信件
Vassal letter of the Turnau bailiff
写给图尔瑙执行官的封臣信函
Vassal charter with von Bergow's seal
带有冯·波尔高印章的封臣信函
A collection of somewhat bawdy poems
Crusaders of the Red Star waffenrock
马列索夫堡垒的房间钥匙
记载了幽默的奇闻轶事的书。
博鲁姆拉卡领主的债券
Waffenrock of the Lords of Garbow
Use to cancel the effect of your opponent's gold badge.
使用后可取消对手的所有徽章效果。
Use to cancel the effect of your opponent's tin badge.
使用后可取消对手的锡制徽章效果。
Use to cancel the effect of your opponent's Silver badge in the game.
使用后可取消对手的银色徽章效果。
The key I found clutched tightly in the hand of a skeleton inside a burnt-out house in Opatowitz.
一具骷髅手中紧握的钥匙，我在奥帕托维茨一所烧毁的房子里发现的。
After your throw, you can reroll up to three dice. Can be used once per game.
掷骰后，你可以重掷最多三枚骰子。每局游戏可使用一次。
After your throw, you can reroll a die of your choosing. Can be used once per game.
掷骰后，你可以选择任一骰子，再次进行投掷。每局游戏可使用一次。
After your throw, you can reroll up to 2 dice Can be used once per game.
掷骰后，你可以重掷最多2枚骰子。每局游戏可使用1次。
After your throw, you can reroll two dice with the same value. Can be used once per game.
掷骰后，你可以选择任两个点数相同的骰子进行重掷。每局游戏可使用一次。
After your throw, you can reroll a die of your choosing. Can be used once per game.
掷骰后，你可以选择任一骰子，再次进行投掷。每局游戏可使用一次。
After your throw, change a die of your choosing to a 1. Can be used once per game.
掷骰后，你可以选择任一骰子，将其点数更改为1。每局游戏可使用1次。
After your throw, you can change a die of your choosing to a 3. Can be used once per game.
掷骰后，你可以选择任一骰子，将其点数更改为3。每局游戏可使用1次。
After your throw, you can change a die of your choosing to a five. Can be used once per game.
掷骰后，你可以选择任一骰子，将其点数更改为5。每局游戏可使用一次。
Using it will double the score of your last roll. Can be used once per game.
使用后可让你上一次掷骰的分数翻倍。每局游戏可使用一次。
Whoever runs away, wins: If you cannot fight, you must at least know how to run fast. This book contains a list of many useful phrases you can use to surrender in a number of languages!
在战斗中，谁跑得快，谁就能赢！如果你不太能打，至少要会跑！实在不行，这本书里还有一系列有用的词句，可以教会你用各种语言投降！
Punches, Kicks and a Few Slaps I
A skill book on Unarmed combat.
一本关于徒手格斗的技能书。
If someone strikes you with a knee, hit him back with your fist: Covers, grasps and grips as simple as a slap. How to use the whole body, both yours and your opponent's, in a fight.
如果有人用膝盖撞你，就用拳头回应：除了简单地打他一巴掌，还可以保护躯体，或是抓住对方的肢体从而控制住他。学会利用自己和对手的身体，在战斗中至关重要。
Punches, Kicks and a Few Slaps II
A skill book on Unarmed combat. Can be read from level 5 of this skill.
一本关于徒手格斗的技能书。徒手格斗5级时可以阅读。
Red shirt and brown hoses: Appropriate clothing for a fight. The right clothing does not weigh the fighter down! It does not limit movement, but it can save one's dignity.
红衬衫和棕色裤袜是适合战斗的服装。合适的服装不会为战士徒增负担！它们不会限制你的活动，还能保护你的尊严。
Punches, Kicks and a Few Slaps III
A skill book on Unarmed combat. Can be read from level 10 of this skill.
一本关于徒手格斗的技能书。徒手格斗10级时可以阅读。
The power of the voice, or scars on body and soul. A well-aimed and timed taunt will do half the work for you. Why strain your body when you can also hurt with words?
话语的力量：自内而外的伤害。一句恰到好处的嘲讽往往让你事半功倍，若是能用言语击倒别人，又何必费力动手呢？
A skill book on Unarmed combat. Can be read from level 15 of this skill.
一本关于徒手格斗的技能书。徒手格斗15级时可以阅读。
Punches, Kicks and a Few Slaps IV
A page torn from a book. There's an unusual rhyme written on it.
从一本书上撕下的一页纸，上面写着奇怪的童谣。

When you pick a rose, take care,
that this bold action that you dare
does not bring a wound to bear. Care for the flower and sing to it secretly,
with words of love that caress so sweetly. That a now dead thing once slept unmoving
In the warmth of your heart is brightly blooming.

若你摘蔷薇，千万要当心。
花茎刺尖锐，
切莫填伤痕。 甜言抚花瓣，
蜜语随歌吟。 本是沉沦一枯枝，
得汝倾心绽光明。

<paragraph><inc>I</inc> hereby authorize my servant, Captain Bushek, called Oak, to represent me in my vassal duties to Lord von Bergow. Let him be in charge of the armed company and share in any booty.</paragraph><paragraph>Set down by Knight Hynek von Platz</paragraph>
<paragraph><inc>本</inc>人特此授权我的部下，波塞克队长，即杜布先生，代由履行对冯·波尔高大人的封臣职责。请让他执掌军队，指挥歼敌，并分享一切战利品。</paragraph><paragraph>骑士斯崔兹·海尼克参上</paragraph>

<paragraph><inc>W</inc>e hereby call upon our subjects of the town of Turnau to fulfill their duty to send their armed troops to the castle of Trosky within three days. There it will assist us in combating the evil captors who have long been plundering and bitterly harassing our region.</paragraph><paragraph>Signed Otto III von Bergow</paragraph>
<paragraph><inc>我</inc>们特此呼吁图尔瑙的封臣履行职责，于三天内向特罗斯基派遣军队，协助我们打击那里的可憎恶徒，阻止他们长期以来在本领域内侵扰不断、抢劫掳掠的恶行。</paragraph><paragraph>奥托三世，冯·波尔高签署</paragraph>

<paragraph><inc>W</inc>e wish to make known our will to you, and we call you as a good servant to fulfill your duties to keep your vassal promise. Arrive in three days with your armed band at the castle of Trosky and be of help to us in fighting the evil bandits who have long plundered and bitterly plagued our region.</paragraph><paragraph>Signed Otto III von Bergow</paragraph>
<paragraph><inc>请</inc>聆听我们的诉求，我们向你发出呼吁，要你履行封臣之职责，遵守诸侯之承诺。请于三日内率军抵达特罗斯基，协助我们打击那些在我们领土内侵扰不断、抢劫掳掠的可恨强盗。</paragraph><paragraph>奥托三世，冯·波尔高签署。</paragraph>

My good friend, perhaps a few of my verses will please you as much as they pleased me when I wrote them with a poor quill and weak ink in captivity in Presburg, Hungary.Little tit, thou fearest nothing,
that dread birds of prey pursue thee.
Singing sweetly is your sole pleasure.I would guard thee, pretty bird,
no cage I'd have, but freedom with thee.
We'd fly beyond the Danube, over the northern forests,
my heart would beat for you alone.He who has no freedom, neither can he give it,
but only sing that once again, the earth shall turn green in the spring.
To no one by debt and none by command, only to the smiles of girls does my heart confess.

当我被囚于匈牙利普雷斯堡，用用破烂的羽毛笔和淡薄的墨水写下它们时，我感到了一丝欣喜。挚友哟，希望这种喜悦能通过这些分享给你。小小的鸟儿呀，你无所畏惧。
纵有恶鸟追逐，
你亦歌喉嘹亮。小小的鸟儿呀，我与你齐飞。
飞出这钢铁的囚笼，跃向自由的天空。
飞过多瑙河的碧波，穿过北方茫茫林海，
我的真心只为你而跃动。我已失却了自由，又何以予你自由？
小小的鸟儿呀，歌唱着又绿一春。
纵使牢狱缠身，也唯有少女笑颜，让我心倾。

If a boy and girl should happen to
come together in a room,
How happy is that couple! Then the glow ofAmor rises, rises double!
When they lie in bed,
by shame they are not troubled,
'Tis then a game begins
'twixt their lips, their arms, their limbs.

男孩和女孩，
相处共一室，
欢乐时光就开始。 爱神送祝愿，
爱意浮心间，
羞耻皆尽抛脑后。
亲吻臂膀拥，肢体相交缠，
嬉乐难言明，今夜多漫长。

Veni, veni, venias,
ne me mori facias,
hyrca, hyrca, nazaza,
trillirivos! Pulchra tibi facies,
oculorum acies,
capillorum series,
o quam clara species! Rosa rubicundior,
lilio candidior,
omnibus formosior,
semper in te glorior!

Veni, veni, venias,
ne me mori facias,
hyrca, hyrca, nazaza,
trillirivos! Pulchra tibi facies,
oculorum acies,
capillorum series,
o quam clara species! Rosa rubicundior,
lilio candidior,
omnibus formosior,
semper in te glorior!
<title>Carmina Burana</title><subtitle>songs of the pupils of the scoundrels</subtitle><newpage/>
<title>卡尔米纳·布拉纳</title><subtitle>学生混混之歌</subtitle><newpage/>

Sie puer cum puellula
moraretur in cellula,
felix coniunctio. Amore sucrescente,
pariter e medio
propulso procul tedio,
fit ludus ineffabilis
membris, lacertis, labiis.

Sie puer cum puellula
moraretur in cellula,
felix coniunctio. Amore sucrescente,
pariter e medio
propulso procul tedio,
fit ludus ineffabilis
membris, lacertis, labiis.

Come now, come now, come to me,
leave me not to die, I pray.
Hyrca, hyrca, nazaza,
trillirivos! Beautiful your pretty face,
Radiant your lovely gaze,
Your hair in tresses all arranged,
How your appearance does amaze! Rosier than theRose are you,
whiter than the lily too,
fairer than all other girls,
for me forever glorious!

来吧，来吧，来我身旁，
请不要让我孤独终老，
Hyrca, hyrca, nazaza,
trillirivos! 娇羞的容颜，
明艳的眼眸，
迷人的发辫，
你是世间无双的珍宝！ 红艳胜玫瑰，
白皙赛百合，
你的美貌举世无双，
你是我生命唯一的快乐！

Behold the dance, the body's joy,
passionate and glittering. What the tongue cannot achieve,
courageous steps may bring. The dance, I say, is life itself,
easy, hard or sometimes gentle.
And little serves or tolerates
the old, the pious and the sensible.

见卿翩起舞，身心俱欣欢，
激情似灼焰，璀璨夺人眼。 唇舌终有难辩处，
踏步亦须携勇敢。 我言人生如此舞，
此时得意彼时艰。
人生回首皆虚幻，
当把酒时需尽欢。

<heading>March 14th</heading><paragraph>I stand alone on a hill with fallen knights lying around me. A storm is coming. The ravens are coming. One of them sits on my sword stuck in the ground. I try to get to it, but I can't take a step. I fall to my knees. And then it's dark.</paragraph><newpage/>
<heading>3月14日</heading><paragraph>我独自站立于山丘之上，四周尽是倒下的骑士，风暴将至，乌鸦盘旋。我的剑插在地上，一只乌鸦停在上面。我想拔出剑，但我无法迈出一步。我跪倒在地，眼前一片黑暗。</paragraph><newpage/>
<title>Diary of Dreams</title><subtitle>to Otto from Henry of Rosenberg</subtitle><newpage/>
<title>关于梦的日记</title><subtitle>罗森堡的亨利 致奥托</subtitle><newpage/>
<heading>May 10th</heading><paragraph>The dream with the crown comes back to me again. I haven't dreamt anything else for three nights now. Nothing helps.</paragraph><newpage/>
<heading>5月10日</heading><paragraph>皇冠的梦再次萦绕在我的脑海。这三天我一直梦到它，做什么都没有用。</paragraph><newpage/>

<heading>May 5th</heading><paragraph>I walk around Trosky while a great banquet is going on in the great hall. Dozens of nobles and noble ladies. Many of them are now dead, but in my dream they sit drinking wine and rejoicing with the living.</paragraph><paragraph>Suddenly time stops. They all freeze like stone statues. The wine being poured stops in mid-air. The only thing that moves is me. I should be confused, maybe even scared, but I'm not. I feel like I can do anything.</paragraph><paragraph>I walk among the nobles and noble ladies. I take whatever I want. I touch whatever I want... I know they'll never come out of their stupor.</paragraph><newpage/>

<heading>5月5日</heading><paragraph>我在特罗斯基四处走动，大厅里正举办盛大的宴会，有数十位贵族和贵妇参加。这些人里有不少已经去世了，但在梦里，他们和活人一同饮酒欢庆。</paragraph><paragraph>突然，时间停止了，所有人都像石雕一样静止不动，就连倒出的酒也静止在了半空中。唯一能动的就是我，我本该困惑，甚至畏惧，但我没有，我感觉我无所不能。</paragraph><paragraph>我在贵族和贵妇之间走动。我拿我想要的，触摸我想触摸的……我知道他们永远不会从这种昏迷状态中醒来。</paragraph><newpage/>

<heading>May 26th</heading><paragraph>I'm standing in front of a huge mirror, looking at my wrinkles. I see how I've aged. Every redness of my skin. I feel every hair that falls out...</paragraph><paragraph>But suddenly the reflection changes. The mirror ripples like the surface of water and I see myself in it young and vibrant again. I can't believe it. I look around. I strip naked, trying to find something to destroy the illusion of youth, but it's perfect. Not a wrinkle anywhere.</paragraph><paragraph>I can't stand the view. I'm filled with rage. I lunge for my reflection. My hands pass through the mirror and tighten around my young neck. I'm choking, but my young self doesn't notice. Instead, I lose my own breath until I finally fall to the floor.</paragraph><newpage/><newpage/><newpage/><newpage/>

<heading>5月26日</heading><paragraph>我梦见我站在一面巨大的镜子前，看着我的皱纹。我看着我慢慢变老，每一处皮肤都长出红斑，每一根头发都逐渐掉落……</paragraph><paragraph>但突然，镜子像水面一样泛起波纹，我又在镜子中看到我年轻时的样子，充满活力。我不敢相信，我环顾四周，脱光衣服，试图找到能破坏这年轻的假象的证据。但镜中的身体非常完美，没有任何年月的痕迹。</paragraph><paragraph>我无法维持这个样貌。愤怒开始充斥我的内心。我扑向我的倒影。我的手穿过了镜子，紧紧扼住年轻的我的脖子。我快要窒息，但他并未察觉。我逐渐失去呼吸，最后倒在了地上。</paragraph><newpage/><newpage/><newpage/><newpage/>

<heading>March 17th</heading><paragraph>I'm walking down a dark corridor. Somewhere in the distance ahead of me, something shimmers. I don't know what it is, but I feel I must reach it. I'm getting closer. Closer and closer, until I can vaguely make out what I'm looking at...</paragraph><paragraph>The St. Wenceslas' Crown! It's so beautiful. And so close... I could reach it...</paragraph><newpage/><paragraph>I'm not walking, I'm running. I reach out my hand. I can already feel the golden coolness of the crown with my fingertips. But suddenly a fox leaps in front of me, clutching a small bird in its mouth. A little kingfisher, trying in vain to get out!</paragraph><paragraph>The fox sits down in front of the crown and refuses to let me near it.</paragraph><newpage/>

<heading>3月17日</heading><paragraph>我行走在黑暗的回廊里。远处光芒闪烁，我不知道那是什么，但我觉得我必须去那里。我越来越近，越来越近，直到我依稀能够辨认……</paragraph><paragraph>那是圣瓦茨拉夫的皇冠！多么美丽。而且近在咫尺……触手可及……</paragraph><paragraph>我不再行走，而是奔跑起来。我伸出手，指尖已经传来皇冠那金色的凉意……突然，一只狐狸跳到我面前，嘴里叼着一只小鸟，那是一只小翠鸟，无论怎么挣扎，也逃不出狐狸的魔爪。</paragraph><paragraph>狐狸就坐在皇冠前，不让我靠近。</paragraph><newpage/>
<title>草药集</title><subtitle>各种草药的治疗效果</subtitle><newpage/>

<heading>Oregano</heading> <paragraph>The Greek origin of the name - "joy of the mountain" also provides a clue to the special properties of this herb. I see here an opportunity for a lucrative commercial enterprise, if I can come to an arrangement with some of the mine custodians.</paragraph><paragraph>Unquestionably, those gentlemen would be very pleased and grateful if I could enhance the miners' ability to find ore and thus increase their profits!</paragraph> <newpage/>
<heading>牛至</heading> <paragraph>它的名字起源于希腊语“山中的喜悦”，顾名思义，我们能从中窥见这种草药的一些独特特性。这显然很有市场，我该去向矿场老板们推销它。</paragraph><paragraph>毫无疑问，要是我的药提高了矿工发现矿石的能力并为他们带来更多利润，那帮先生肯定会对我感恩戴德的！</paragraph><newpage/>

My love for you is heartfelt.
You can tell from my unbuckled belt.
My mind is troubled badly
by one question above all:
When will my lover fondly
caress my left ball?
"Love thy neighbour", saith Our Lord.
and I took it to heart.
I started to fulfil His word,
at least in their southern part.
My heart is mourning dejectedly.
Even my hand rejected me!
By day and night I think of you,
I shall love you always.
My heart is faithful, loyal and true,
Though my body sometimes strays.
A knight in battle attire
got into bed with his squire.
Instead of conquering forts,
They played with each other's swords.

我对你乃情真意切，
你看我已宽衣解带。
我是如此心烦意乱，
只因疑问迟未解惑：
爱人何时温柔伸手，
爱抚把玩身下之物？
主曾说过，“要爱邻舍”，
虔诚如我，自当践行。
哪怕于人不动真心，
至少献爱于其下体。
我心因悲伤而哀悼，
乃至手也弃我而去。
日日夜夜想念着你，
我的爱将永恒长存。
吾心虔诚，忠贞不渝，
唯有身体，偶求欢愉。
战场骑士，身披战袍，
呼唤侍从，与他同床。
攻城掠地，不解风情，
尚方宝剑，互相拼命。

<heading>Elderberry</heading> <paragraph>I believe my theory of the efficacy of this plant will one day be proven beyond a doubt, although, unfortunately, it may take many years before the results can be ascertained. Nonetheless, since I use this herb myself daily, I shall almost certainly live to see its beneficial effects on longevity as well as inducing the wisdom of the elders, to which I look forward.</paragraph><newpage/>
<heading>接骨木莓</heading> <paragraph>我相信，我关于这种植物功效的理论终有一天会得到确凿无疑的证明，虽然不幸的是，这可能需要花上很多年，甚至几十年才能确定结果。尽管如此，由于我自己每天都在服用这种草药，我几乎肯定会活着看到它对长寿的益处，以及诱发长者智慧的作用，对此我充满期待。</paragraph><newpage/>
<heading>False Hellebores</heading> <paragraph>I hesitate to attempt using this plant, lest it conjure up demons, whether false or real!</paragraph>
<heading>藜芦</heading> <paragraph>我还在犹豫要不要对它进行实验，感觉会召唤出恶魔来！</paragraph>
<heading>Gratiole</heading> <paragraph>Also known as Grace of God. I tried some out on that grouch Kabat, but he shows not the slightest sign of gratitude nor grace!</paragraph><newpage/>
<heading>水八角</heading> <paragraph>又叫“上帝之恩典”，我让那个脾气暴躁的卡巴特试过，但他既没有表现出丝毫的感激之情，也没有蒙受恩典的样子！</paragraph><newpage/>

<heading>Hemlock</heading> <paragraph>I have tried to use this strange herb perhaps ten times, but always in vain. Drying, grinding, boiling, decanting, inhaling, oral, surface and rectal use,... In short, nothing works, and I have run out of subjects to test it on, due to many undesirable side effects, including death, and even the least attentive hired hand is wary, lest I put something in their food. In fact, the herb seems to induce the total opposite to the desired result, causing trembling of the hands, staggering, panting and nausea, instead of improving agility and stealth ability.</paragraph><paragraph>Alas, I shall have to give up my experiments. In short, even the most dextrous of subjects shows no improvement in lock-picking skills - on the contrary, the herb actually causes... </paragraph><newpage/>

<heading>毒芹</heading> <paragraph>我曾经尝试过十次左右，但一直徒劳无功。晾干、研磨、煮沸、倾倒、吸入、口服、外用及直肠给药等方法都试过，但是没有任何药效。而由于有不少包含死亡在内的副作用，我也再找不到试验对象了，就连最不细心的雇工也成日提心吊胆，生怕我在他们的饭菜里放了东西。我本以为它能提高灵巧和潜行能力，结果几乎完全是相反的效果，它会导致手颤、步履蹒跚、气喘和恶心等症状。</paragraph><paragraph>唉，看来我得放弃这个实验了。简而言之，即便是最灵巧的实验对象也并未因为用药在撬锁技能上有任何提升，反而会……</paragraph><newpage/>

<heading>Mercurialis</heading> <paragraph>Nevertheless, I have had promising results with this plant! Its effects are truly mercurial, causing the test subjects to run hither and thither at great speed, although they themselves foolishly reported that this was due to a sudden pressing urge to defecate and urinate. Running at speed is certainly a useful skill for messengers, although the tendency of the subjects to run away from people rather than towards them is admittedly a disadvantage.</paragraph>However, I do not despair. I still believe the addition of other ingredients, such as bittersweet nightshade, orchis mascula, or perhaps maybe calla and butterbur might reduce the side-effects and allow me to create true messengers of the gods.</paragraph><newpage/>

<heading>山靛</heading> <paragraph>这种草药的效果意外挺不错的！它的药效变化较快，能让受试者来回飞速奔跑。尽管这帮人报告说是因为突然的排泄冲动才跑起来的，但那真是够蠢的。对信使来说快速奔跑毫无疑问是十分有用的技能，只不过比起跑向人群，他们更倾向于往反方向跑得远远的，不得不说这确实是一个缺点。</paragraph><paragraph>不过这只是小问题，加入一些其他成分应该就能缓解副作用了。我该试试小癫茄和红门兰，或者是马蹄莲和蜂斗菜，我的药最后肯定能让人像神之信使一样快！</paragraph><newpage/>
